resources.string: Underweight individuals have a BMI below 18.5. This category indicates that a persons weight is insufficient for their height, which may be associated with health risks such as malnutrition and a weakened immune system.

A BMI between 18.5 and 24.99 is considered a normal weight. This range is associated with a balanced weight-to-height ratio, typically reflecting good overall health and a lower risk of weight-related health issues.

Overweight individuals have a BMI between 25 and 29.99. This category indicates an excess of body weight relative to height, potentially leading to health concerns like heart disease, diabetes, and joint problems.

Obesity is defined as having a BMI of 30 or higher. It signifies a significant excess of body fat, which can increase the risk of severe health conditions, including heart disease, type 2 diabetes, and certain types of cancer.
